Title: Development of Japanese comic as an illustration and cultural ideology propaganda
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pratama, W., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suprayitno, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adi, D., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Illustration, a picture with a specific message, has become a part of the information delivery since thousands of yearago. The visual becomes graphic narrative means the image composition is modified in such a way as to produce story and message. Comic is a visual illustration that created moves or sequential story as a way to strengthen its message, ideology, and propaganda as well as the story. Japan as a developed country in Asia is trying to implement the modernization of the visual narrative in the industrial sector. They maintain a cultural identity that packaged by cultural mixing with modernity understanding. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Ajidarma, S.G., (2005) Tiga Panji Tengkorak: Kebudayaan Dalam Perbincangan, , Disertasi Doktor Fakultas Ilmu Pengetahuan Budaya Universitas Indonesia, Depok; Atmowiloto, A., (1982), pp. 109-120. , Komik dan Kebudayaan Nasional, Analisis Kebudayaan, Tahun II, Nomor 1-1981/1982; Bonneff, M., Indonesia, K., (1998), Kepustakaan Populer Gramedia (KPG), Jakarta; Eisner, W., (1985) Comics and Sequential Art, , W.W. Authors: Adi D., Pratama W., Suprayitno, Wijasa H.K.S.
Title: Interpretation from the illustrations of Soeharto on the cover of TEMPO, an independent Indonesian weekly news magazine
Affiliations: School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adi, D., School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratama, W., School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suprayitno, School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijasa, H.K.S., School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The illustration on the cover of a magazine is to give identity and also to attract attention which requires synergy between writers and artists in order to deliver messages in visual language. This paper will discuss the illustration and visual language as well as and readers interpretation and the impact to the media where the illustration is displayed. The study was conducted qualitative research method from Illustrations of former President Soeharto on Tempo magazines covers after his resignation until his death in 2008 as a case study, and the cover of Soeharto in New Order era as a comparison. From the research is expected to obtain an overview of how the message is delivered using visual language in the illustration and its impact to the reader. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Hall, A., (2011) Illustration, , Laurence King Publisher, London, UK; Male, A., (2007) Illustration: A Theoretical and Contextual Perspective, AVA Publishing, , Lausanne, Switzerland; Steele, J., (2005) Wars Within: The Story of Tempo, an Independent Magazine in Soeharto’s Indonesia, , Equinox Publishing, Jakarta; (2011), 2, p. 925. , ISSN 2087-1236; (2008) Pemimpin Redaksi Majalah Tempo Minta Maaf,” TEMPO, , http://www.tempo.co/read/news/2008/02/05/055116950/Pemimpin-Redaksi-Majalah-Tempo-Minta-Maaf, February 8; www.komisiinformasi.go.id/regulasi/download/id/140
Correspondence Address: Adi, D.; School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Indonesia

Title: Assessing creativity skill development in art and design among undergraduate students: Implementing creative potential simulation software to capture creativity-relevant personal characteristics
Source title: Proceedings of 2013 IEEE International Conference on Teaching, Assessment and Learning for Engineering, TALE 2013
Authors with affiliations: Setiadi, N.J., BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; So, I.G., BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suprayitno, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Identification of creativity skill development among undergraduate art and design students was assessed using a computer software creativity simulation. This software has been developed and evaluated with two groups of Art and Design students of a private university in Indonesia. The study presents preliminary findings of an examination creative behavioral model. This examination presents data supporting reliability and validity of the instrument. Student learning of creativity skill was evident using the creative potential simulation software. Results of a factor analysis indicated a five factor solution of creative characteristics and behavior. Discussion of findings and the benefits of computer simulations for learning and assessment of creativity skills are presented. © 2013 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Art and Design Student Learning; Creative behavior; Creative-relevant personal characteristics; Creativity simulation software
Index Keywords: Creative behavior; Creative potentials; Personal characteristics; Reliability and validity; Simulation software; Skill development; Student learning; Undergraduate students; Computer simulation; Computer software; Design; Engineering education; Students
